B.name: Bill
B.description: A bill is a proposal for new legislation or an amendment to existing legislation.

R.name: Resolution
R.description: A resolution is a formal expression of opinion or intention by a legislative body.

CR.name: Concurrent Resolution
CR.description: A concurrent resolution is a legislative measure adopted by both houses of a bicameral legislature.

JR.name: Joint Resolution
JR.description: A joint resolution is a legislative measure that requires approval by both houses of a bicameral legislature and is presented to the executive for approval.

JRCA.name: Joint Resolution Constitutional Amendment
JRCA.description: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution.

EO.name: Executive Order
EO.description: An executive order is a directive issued by the Governor to manage the operations of the State government.

CA.name: Constitutional Amendment
CA.description: A constitutional amendment is a formal change to the Constitution.

M.name: Memorial
M.description: A memorial is a formal request or petition to the legislature.

CL.name: Claim
CL.description: A claim is a formal request for compensation or reimbursement.

C.name: Commendation
C.description: A commendation is a formal expression of praise or recognition.

CSR.name: Committee Study Request
CSR.description: A committee study request is a formal request for a committee to conduct a study on a specific issue.

JM.name: Joint Memorial
JM.description: A joint memorial is a formal request or petition to the legislature, adopted by both houses.

P.name: Proclamation
P.description: A proclamation is an official announcement or declaration.

SR.name: Study Request
SR.description: A study request is a formal request for a committee to conduct a study on a specific issue.

A.name: Address
A.description: An address is a formal speech or statement delivered to the legislature.

CM.name: Concurrent Memorial
CM.description: A concurrent memorial is a formal request or petition to the legislature, adopted by both houses.

I.name: Initiative
I.description: An initiative is a proposal for new legislation or an amendment to existing legislation, submitted by the public.

PET.name: Petition
PET.description: A petition is a formal request or appeal to the legislature.

SB.name: Study Bill
SB.description: A study bill is a proposal for new legislation or an amendment to existing legislation, submitted for study and consideration.

IP.name: Initiative Petition
IP.description: An initiative petition is a formal request for a public vote on a proposed law or amendment to existing law.

RB.name: Repease Bill
RB.description: A repease bill is a proposal for the repeal of existing legislation.

RM.name: Remonstration
RM.description: A remonstration is a formal protest or objection to a proposed law or action.

CB.name: Committee Bill
CB.description: A committee bill is a proposal for new legislation or an amendment to existing legislation, submitted by a committee.
